(Just a heads up, this is based off of Second Movie Hiccup.)

You wake up on a gravelly surface. Sitting up, you hold your forehead and look around - and freeze. Grass blades shoot up over your head! You've been shrunk!

Scrambling to your feet, you look around more at your surroundings. Massive huts, several times larger than buildings you were used to, surround you.

"What's going on?!" you yell.

Almost as if in answer, a series of booms sound from around the corner of the nearest building. You turn and stare as a massive teenager strolls into view. He is lean, handsome, and dressed in leather armor. You notice that his left leg has been amputated and replaced with a metal one - and then you notice it and his other foot coming straight for you.

"Hey, hey!" You yell and wave your arms, while at the same time trying to get out of his way. He glances around, then down.

"What the heck?"

His voice is deafening as he speaks directly at you, only inches away. The teenager kneels down, and you suddenly feel very uneasy as this giant looms over you. You don't even come up to his ankles.

"What happened to you?"

"I...I..." You're at a loss for words.

Now you see his hand coming down. His thumb pushes against your chest, easily knocking you into his palm. The teen tilts his hand to be flat and then stands up again. The rush upwards leaves your stomach behind. Even laying spread-eagled on his hand, you don't take up all the space on his palm. He holds you in front of his chest, staring at you with curiosity.

"I...I don't know what happened." You slowly begin to get to your feet. "I just woke up here, and I was...like this."

Looking up at his face, you can see his green eyes, each many times bigger than your head, and a forest of brown hair that you could probably get lost in. You're relieved to also see a look of pity and concern.

"I'll help get you back to normal. Somehow..." He shakes his head and smirks. "I'm just glad I found you before someone else did, someone less understanding. My name's Hiccup, by the way." He offers his finger, which you take with two hands and shake. "Now, let's get going."

Hiccup carefully slips you under a belt that wraps around his torso; you're small enough to fit without your toes sticking out the bottom. Hoping no one will see you, you hook onto the belt with both arms as Hiccup begins walking, his thundering steps bobbing you up and down through the village. Pressed against his torso, you can hear the deep gurgles emanating from his body, and you hope that everything turns out alright.
